guides.name: CUPS: Remote printer
guides.introduction: My dad got an old printer from a garage sale and though the printer is excellent it does not have wireless printing. The printer itself is of good quality and for a few dollars it was worth the money. Instead of trying to find some fancy printer, I decided to try to see if I can find a workaround for this. And since I like learning new things, especially related to tech, that is exactly what I did. I used CUPS to along with my Raspberry Pi 3B+ to turn the printer into a wireless printer! blurbs.title: Description
blurbs.text:
1. Install CUPS using: https://www.raspberrypi.com/news/printing-at-home-from-your-raspberry-pi/
  2. To turn the Raspberrry Pi into a print server use: https://www.tomshardware.com/how-to/raspberry-pi-print-server
    • sudo cupsctl --remote-any
  3. Use cupsctl --remote-admin to allow for remote admin
  4. Find your printer driver online
    • Brothers printer drivers
    • In my case I have to find a driver for Brother HL-2040 series https://www.openprinting.org/printer/Brother/Brother-HL-2040
